Yes, it's always a good idea to have a backup plan in case of unexpected closures or delays during your commute. Here are some alternative modes of transportation that you can consider:

1. Bus: Instead of the Metro, you can use the local bus service in your area. This may require a bit more planning, as bus routes and schedules may be different from the Metro, but it can be a reliable alternative option.

2. Carpooling: If you have friends or colleagues who live and work near you, you can consider carpooling. This can help reduce traffic congestion and save on gas and parking expenses.

3. Biking: If you live close enough to your workplace, you can consider biking as an alternative mode of transportation. It is environmentally friendly, good exercise and can save you money.

4. Ridesharing services: Ridesharing services like Uber and Lyft can also be a good option for certain situations, such as unexpected closures or when you need to get somewhere quickly.

5. Walking: If you live close to your workplace or the area you need to get to, walking can be a viable alternative. It is a healthy travel option and doesn't require any fare.

Always make sure to plan ahead and look into all of your options to find the best alternative transportation, depending on your specific needs and circumstances.
